snippet: In imposing restrictions on the American satellite navigation system, Russia is answering the refusal of the United States to allow similar base stations on its soil.
abstract: Russian Deputy Prime Min Dmitri O Rogozin, who is in charge of space programs, says he has begun imposing restrictions on country's Global Positioning System base stations as retribution for United States' refusal to allow similar base stations on American territory that would benefit Russia; announcement comes as another sign of souring relations between countries.
lead_paragraph: In imposing restrictions on the American satellite navigation system, Russia is answering the refusal of the United States to allow similar base stations on its soil.

headline.main: In GPS Battle, Russia Sets Restrictions of Its Own
headline.print_headline: In GPS Battle, Russia Sets Restrictions of Its Own
